title.text: SUBLANGUAGE ENGINEERING IN THE FOG SYSTEM

abstractContent.text: FoG currently produces bilingual marine and public weather forecasts at several Canadian weather offices.
The system is engineered to reflect "good professional style" as found inhuman forecasts.
However , some regularization and simplification of the output has been needed.

Sub-language engineering issues include trade-offs in coverage and style, handling variation and evolution of sublanguages, "leg-islating" lexical semantics and assuring a language model able to accomodate new text types and support spoken output.
